properties.Name: Parkman Bandstand
properties.Address: Boston Common, on the eastern side
properties.Descr: Landmark bandstand used for concerts, plays, rallies, speeches

properties.Name: Swan Boats
properties.Descr: The Swan Boats are a fleet of dual-pontooned pleasure boats which operate in a pond in the Public Garden in Boston, Massachusetts. The Swan Boats have been in operation since 1877, and have since become a cultural icon for the city.

properties.Name: Massachusetts State House
properties.Descr: Grand, circa-1795 building where the state legislature meets, with monuments, free tours & more.

properties.Name: Central Burying Ground
properties.Descr: The Central Burying Ground is a cemetery in Boston, Massachusetts. It was established on the Boston Common in 1756.

properties.Name: Boston Common
properties.Descr: Storied, nearly 50-acre urban park that hosted British troops during the American Revolution.

properties.Name: Boston Public Garden
properties.Descr: Placid, verdant, circa-1837 city park with a lagoon, boat rides, fountains & other sights.

properties.Name: The Esplanade
properties.Descr: This waterfront promenade features 3 play areas, multiple docks, sports fields & seasonal events.

properties.Name: Exercise Course
properties.Address: by the Silber Way Footbridge between the Mass Ave. and BU Bridge
properties.Descr: Provides basic outdoor gym equipment for the benefit of park visitors. Course includes equipment for body weight exercises such as pull ups as well as equipment for stretching.

properties.Name: Back Bay Fens
properties.Descr: This large greenspace has multiple gardens, playgrounds, ball fields & memorials, plus picnic areas.

properties.Name: Ramler Park
properties.Descr: Small city sanctuary filled with flowering trees designed to attract migrating birds.

properties.Name: Symphony Road Community Garden
properties.Address:
Symphony Road Community Garden
69 Symphony Rd

properties.Name: Kenmore Square
properties.Descr: Kenmore Square is a square in Boston, Massachusetts, United States, consisting of the intersection of several main avenues as well as several other cross streets, and Kenmore Station, an MBTA subway stop.

properties.Name: Fenway Park
properties.Descr: Historic, small-capacity ballpark, home of the Red Sox & occasional big-name concert venue.

properties.Name: Fenway Victory Gardens
properties.Descr: This literal WWII victory garden from 1942 is now made up of 7.5 acres of produce & flowers.

properties.Name: Steriti Rink
properties.Descr: Public, indoor ice rink providing rental skates, a snack bar & harbor views. Open seasonally.

properties.Name: Langone Park
properties.Descr: Bordered by Boston Harbor, the site offers a playground, softball field & 3 regulation bocce courts.

properties.Name: Andrew P. Puopolo. Junior Athletic Field
properties.Descr: Andrew P. Puopolo Field has been the longtime home of the Suffolk University Softball team.

properties.Name: Copp's Hill Terrace
properties.Descr: Copp's Hill Terrace is an historic terrace and park between Commercial and Charter Streets west of Jackson Avenue on Copp's Hill in the North End of Boston, Massachusetts near Copp's Hill Burying Ground.

properties.Name: Copp's Hill Burying Ground
properties.Descr: Copp's Hill Burying Ground is a historic cemetery in the North End of Boston, Massachusetts. Established in 1659, it was originally named "North Burying Ground", and was the city's second cemetery.

properties.Name: North Square Park
properties.Descr: Part of the Freedom Trail, this small historic square offers benches next to the Paul Revere House.

properties.Name: Paul Revere Mall
properties.Descr: Brick-paved park centered around a statue of a horse-mounted Revere on his famous Midnight Ride.

properties.Name: Charter Street Park
properties.Descr: This small, quaint park, tucked away off a cobblestoned lane, features a playground & benches.

properties.Name: Pilot House Park
properties.Descr: A historic commercial building's simple green space on Lewis Wharf, part of the Harborwalk trail.

properties.Name: The Paul Revere House
properties.Descr: Revere's legendary ride began at this restored Colonial-era home, which includes family furnishings.

properties.Name: Old North Church
properties.Descr: Hallowed 18th-century church & launch point for Paul Revere's revolutionary ride, with tours & more.

properties.Name: Publick Theatre
properties.Address: Dr Paul Dudley White Bike Path, Boston, MA 02138

properties.Name: Smith Playground
properties.Address:
Western Ave & N Harvard St
Allston, MA 02134
properties.Descr: The Smith Playground features climbing structures, swings, slides, and more. The structures are geared for children ages five and older, although scrappy toddlers will enjoy the challenging equipment. Numerous playing fields are also available.

properties.Name: Hooker-Sorrento Playground
properties.Descr: A large playground with a fully enclosed toddler area that includes a mini-track circling the area. The older-kids’ area has a swervy mini balance beam. There’s also a sprinkler, various riding toys and a large grassy area.

properties.Name: Penniman Road Play Area
properties.Descr: Nice, small playground, with two climbing structures, a row of swings, and a basketball court right next to it.

properties.Name: Ringer Park
properties.Descr: Recreation area featuring walking paths, fields & a playground, plus basketball & tennis courts.

properties.Name: Ringer Playground
properties.Descr: Local hard-surface playground with slides & swings amid trees, a ball field & tennis courts.

properties.Name: Ringer Park Tennis Courts
properties.Descr: Recreation area featuring walking paths, fields & a playground, plus basketball & tennis courts.

properties.Descr: Venerable institution with interactive exhibits, a dome-shaped IMAX/3D film theater & a planetarium.

properties.Name: Craigie Drawbridge
properties.Descr: The Charles River Dam Bridge, is a six-lane bascule bridge across the Charles River, connecting Leverett Circle in downtown Boston, to Monsignor O'Brien Highway in East Cambridge, Massachusetts.

properties.Name: Portsmouth Playground
properties.Descr: Neighborhood sports field used for both baseball & soccer, plus a basketball court & a playground.

properties.Name: Oak Square YMCA
properties.Descr: Community-focused nonprofit established in 1844 with recreational programs & services for all ages.

properties.Name: The Cenacles
properties.Descr: Peaceful neighborhood grassland area featuring a pond, a range of trails & open recreational space.

properties.Name: Chandler's Pond
properties.Descr: Located within Gallagher Memorial Park, this urban pond is a watering hole for swan, Canada geese, heron, and rabbits. A pleasant walk around two-thirds of the pond takes you through the small park and along Lake Shore Road.

properties.Name: Rogers Park
properties.Descr: This 8.14-acre park with tennis, baseball & basketball facilities debuted in 1899.

properties.Name: Fidelis Way Park
properties.Descr: Small neighborhood park featuring basketball courts plus a children's water spray area & playground.

properties.Name: Brian Honan Park
properties.Address: 300 Allston St (at Summit Ave), Brighton, MA 02135

properties.Name: Chestnut Hill Reservation
properties.Descr: Chestnut Hill Reservation is a Massachusetts state park surrounding the Chestnut Hill Reservoir in the Allston-Brighton neighborhood of Boston

properties.Name: Newton Commonwealth Golf Course
properties.Descr: The Newton Commonwealth Golf Course is an 18-hole public golf course located in Newton, Massachusetts, just outside the city of Boston. This course was originally created as a nine hole course in 1897 and was previously named the Commonwealth Club.

properties.Name: Hunnewell Park
properties.Descr: This 4.6-acre park features softball & soccer fields plus a pre-school play area with swings.

properties.Name: Hunnewell Conservation Area
properties.Descr: Park featuring wildflowers, deciduous trees and typical suburban wildlife. Path along wooded slope leads to a playground.

properties.Name: Hardiman Playground
properties.Address: Faneuil St. (at Adair Rd.), Brighton, MA 02135

properties.Name: Oak Square
properties.Descr: Oak Square is a former station on the Green Line "A" Branch. It was closed in 1969 when service on the branch was replaced with buses.

properties.Name: North Point Park
properties.Descr: Waterfront park featuring playgrounds, walking trails & scenic views of the river & skyline.

properties.Name: Nashua Street Park
properties.Descr: A tranquil, urban, waterfront park with grassy areas, paths for walking & benches for relaxing.

properties.Name: Cardinal Cushing Park
properties.Descr: A pocket of green space with a memorial bust of Cardinal Cushing & several wrought-iron benches.

properties.Name: New England Holocaust Memorial
properties.Descr: Holocaust memorial with 6 illuminated glass towers symbolically etched with 6 million numbers.

properties.Name: North End Park
properties.Descr: Park featuring gardens, benches & grass, plus a fountain for children to play in with vertical jets.

properties.Name: Armenian Heritage Park
properties.Descr: City park honoring the immigrant experience with a labyrinth & an abstract sculpture.

properties.Name: Christopher Columbus Waterfront Park
properties.Descr: This popular city park featuring a play area, gardens & views of the water hosts many events.

properties.Name: Wharf District Park
properties.Descr: Bustling urban park providing open lawns, benches, fountains & paved pathways amid waterfront views.

properties.Name: Dewey Square Parks
properties.Descr: Intimate park offering grassy areas with seating, mobile food trucks & a seasonal farmers' market.

properties.Name: Norman B. Leventhal Park
properties.Descr: Pleasant city-center park with a garden trellis & walk-through sculptural fountain.

properties.Name: Irish Famine Memorial
properties.Descr: Snug park along the Freedom Trail commemorating the 1845 Irish potato famine with statues & plaques.

properties.Name: Granary Burying Ground
properties.Address: Tremont St (between Park and School Sreets), Boston, MA 02108
properties.Descr: Samuel Adams & Paul Revere are among the patriots buried at this storied site on the Freedom Trail.

properties.Name: King's Chapel Cemetery
properties.Descr: King's Chapel Burying Ground is a historic cemetery at King's Chapel on Tremont Street in Boston, Massachusetts. It is the oldest cemetery in the city and is a site on the Freedom Trail.

properties.Name: Old City Hall
properties.Descr: Boston's Old City Hall was home to its city council from 1865 to 1969. It was one of the first buildings in the French Second Empire style to be built in the United States.

properties.Name: Rose Fitzgerald Kennedy Greenway Conservancy
properties.Descr: A 1.5 mile string of parks with a carousel, grassy areas & rotating contemporary art exhibitions.

properties.Name: Eliot Norton Park
properties.Descr: Tiny, tranquil spot with shade trees, lawn areas, benches & paths, plus a playground.
